channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The FAA has ordered flights be scaled back. Here's how airlines are responding
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Chris Sununu, president of the Airlines for America trade organization, about how airlines are responding to the FAA's flight reduction order.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Chris Sununu, president of the Airlines for America trade organization, about how airlines are responding to the FAA's flight reduction order.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Airlines are canceling flights Friday under FAA order amid the shutdown
item.description: The Federal Aviation Administration's order to reduce flights nationwide is set to take effect Friday. The agency says the cuts are needed to keep the skies safe during the government shutdown.
item.content:encoded: The Federal Aviation Administration's order to reduce flights nationwide is set to take effect Friday. The agency says the cuts are needed to keep the skies safe during the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: Is the job market getting worse? As the shutdown continues, this is what we know
item.description: For the second month in a row, a government report on employment and unemployment has been delayed by the federal shutdown. That leaves analysts looking for other signs to gauge the job market.
item.content:encoded:
For the second month in a row, a government report on employment and unemployment has been delayed by the federal shutdown. That leaves analysts looking for other signs to gauge the job market.

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: The FAA's order to reduce flights nationwide goes into effect, the Trump administration will appeal a judge's order to restore SNAP funding, Trump's allies worry he's too focused on foreign policy.
item.content:encoded: The FAA's order to reduce flights nationwide goes into effect, the Trump administration will appeal a judge's order to restore SNAP funding, Trump's allies worry he's too focused on foreign policy.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: ADL creates new 'Mamdani Monitor' project to track his administration policies
item.description: After the ADL announced its scrutiny of Zohran Mamdani, the mayor-elect told reporters, "I take the issue of antisemitism incredibly seriously."
item.content:encoded:
After the ADL announced its scrutiny of Zohran Mamdani, the mayor-elect told reporters, "I take the issue of antisemitism incredibly seriously."

(Image credit: Bryan Bedder)
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Trump administration plans to appeal judge's order to distribute full SNAP benefits
item.description: The Trump administration is appealing a federal judge's order that it must provide full SNAP food benefits. The government had been planning to fund only partial payments this month.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration is appealing a federal judge's order that it must provide full SNAP food benefits. The government had been planning to fund only partial payments this month.
item.dc:creator: Tovia Smith

item.title: Democrats swept Tuesday's election. What it could mean for next year's midterms
item.description: Democrats won every election in the 2025 off-year contests, setting them up for high expectations going into the 2026 midterms. Democrats and Republicans talk about what it could mean going forward.
item.content:encoded: Democrats won every election in the 2025 off-year contests, setting them up for high expectations going into the 2026 midterms. Democrats and Republicans talk about what it could mean going forward.
item.dc:creator: Sarah McCammon

item.title: White House strikes new deals to lower prices on obesity drugs for some
item.description: The Trump administration struck deals with pharmaceutical companies Novo Nordisk and Eli Lilly to lower prices and copays for type 2 diabetes and obesity drugs --- but not everyone will qualify.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration struck deals with pharmaceutical companies Novo Nordisk and Eli Lilly to lower prices and copays for type 2 diabetes and obesity drugs --- but not everyone will qualify.
item.dc:creator: Sydney Lupkin

item.title: Rosalía's 'Lux' showcases bold new era with orchestral sounds and multilingual tracks
item.description: Global pop star Rosalía may stun fans with the direction she's taken on her new album, "Lux." It features a full orchestra, a choir and songs in several different languages.
item.content:encoded: Global pop star Rosalía may stun fans with the direction she's taken on her new album, "Lux." It features a full orchestra, a choir and songs in several different languages.
item.dc:creator: Anamaria Artemisa Sayre

item.title: Trump's allies worry he's spending too much time on foreign policy
item.description: After Tuesday's election results and low approval numbers for Republicans, allies are raising concerns that President Trump is too focused on foreign policy.
item.content:encoded: After Tuesday's election results and low approval numbers for Republicans, allies are raising concerns that President Trump is too focused on foreign policy.
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez
